item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 6, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Did Sandia use a thermonuclear secondary in a product logo? (188 points | 36 comments)
2. Swift is a more convenient Rust (114 points | 86 comments)
3. Intent to unship: HTTP/2 Push (55 points | 10 comments)
4. The Founder Mode Tradeoff – By Kent Beck (7 points | discuss)
5. What happens when you touch a pickle to an AM radio tower (120 points | 31 comments)
6. Understanding the Y Combinator (28 points | 12 comments)
7. UE5 Nanite in WebGPU (336 points | 98 comments)
8. LwIP – Lightweight IP Stack (99 points | 40 comments)
9. Phind-405B and faster, high quality AI answers for everyone (280 points | 116 comments)
10. Name in Landsat (6 points | discuss)
11. The expected value of the game is positive regardless of Ballmer’s strategy (146 points | 107 comments)
12. AlphaProteo generates novel proteins for biology and health research (273 points | 89 comments)
13. Oxford commercializes its 20% more powerful solar panels in the US (45 points | 14 comments)
14. Speeding up Electron apps by using V8 snapshots in the main process (50 points | 33 comments)
15. Deploying rust in existing firmware codebases (157 points | 82 comments)
16. Show HN: Retronews – TUI for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet readers (39 points | 13 comments)
17. Summing Blue Noise Octaves Like Perlin Noise (19 points | 1 comment)
18. The One-Eyed Man Is King: How did the monocle become a symbol of wealth? (10 points | 5 comments)
19. Ask HN: Resources for GPU Compilers? (61 points | 16 comments)
20. The origins of the steam engine (2023) (64 points | 7 comments)
21. Cron Jobs on Linux – Comprehensive Guide with Examples (58 points | 19 comments)
22. Serverless-registry: A Docker registry backed by Workers and R2 (148 points | 61 comments)
23. Launch HN: Maitai (YC S24) – Self-Optimizing LLM Platform (129 points | 70 comments)
24. Show HN: AnythingLLM – Open-Source, All-in-One Desktop AI Assistant (265 points | 64 comments)
25. Common food dye found to make skin and muscle temporarily transparent (244 points | 89 comments)
26. Show HN: We built a FOSS documentation CMS with a pretty GUI (111 points | 19 comments)
27. Study: Playing D&D helps autistic players in social interactions (18 points | 4 comments)
28. Mozilla introduces updates to tab management in Firefox (57 points | 40 comments)
29. Clojure 1.12.0 is now available (279 points | 58 comments)
30. The work you do, the person you are (2017) (54 points | 21 comments)
